put.description: The operation to create or update a export. Update operation requires latest eTag to be set in the request mandatorily. You may obtain the latest eTag by performing a get operation. Create operation does not require eTag.

get.description: Lists all of the available cost management REST API operations.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

Operation.description: A Cost Management REST API operation.

display.description: The object that represents the operation.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed: UsageDetail, etc.

operation.description: Operation type: Read, write, delete, etc.

OperationListResult.description: Result of listing CostManagement operations. It contains a list of operations and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of CostManagement operations supported by the Microsoft.CostManagement resource provider.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results if there are any.

target.description: Indicates which property in the request is responsible for the error.
Indicates which property in the request is responsible for the error.

ErrorResponse.description: Error response indicates that the service is not able to process the incoming request. The reason is provided in the error message.

ExportListResult.description: Result of listing exports. It contains a list of available exports in the scope provided.

schedule.description: Has schedule information for the export.

CommonExportProperties.description: The common properties of the export.

format.description: The format of the export being delivered.

deliveryInfo.description: Has delivery information for the export.

ExportSchedule.description: The schedule associated with a export.

status.description: The status of the schedule. Whether active or not. If inactive, the export's scheduled execution is paused.

recurrencePeriod.description: Has start and end date of the recurrence. The start date must be in future. If present, the end date must be greater than start date.

ExportDeliveryInfo.description: The delivery information associated with a export.

destination.description: Has destination for the export being delivered.

timeframe.description: The time frame for pulling data for the export. If custom, then a specific time period must be provided.

timePeriod.description: Has time period for pulling data for the export.

dataset.description: Has definition for data in this export.

ExportRecurrencePeriod.description: The start and end date for recurrence schedule.

ExportDeliveryDestination.description: The destination information for the delivery of the export.

resourceId.description: The resource id of the storage account where exports will be delivered.

container.description: The name of the container where exports will be uploaded.

rootFolderPath.description: The name of the directory where exports will be uploaded.

ExportTimePeriod.description: The start and end date for pulling data for the export.

from.description: The start date to pull data from.

to.description: The end date to pull data to.

ExportDataset.description: The definition of data present in the export.

granularity.description: The granularity of rows in the export.

configuration.description: Has configuration information for the data in the export. The configuration will be ignored if aggregation and grouping are provided.

aggregation.description: Dictionary of aggregation expression to use in the export. The key of each item in the dictionary is the alias for the aggregated column. Export can have up to 2 aggregation clauses.

grouping.description: Array of group by expression to use in the export. Export can have up to 2 group by clauses.

filter.description: Has filter expression to use in the export.

ExportDatasetConfiguration.description: The configuration of dataset in the export.

columns.description: Array of column names to be included in the export. Any valid export column name is allowed. If not provided, then export includes all columns.

ExportAggregation.description: The aggregation expression to be used in the export.

name.description: The name of the column to aggregate.

function.description: The name of the aggregation function to use.

ExportGrouping.description: The group by expression to be used in the export.

type.description: Has type of the column to group.

name.description: The name of the column to group.

ExportFilter.description: The filter expression to be used in the export.

and.description: The logical "AND" expression. Must have at least 2 items.

or.description: The logical "OR" expression. Must have at least 2 items.

dimension.description: Has comparison expression for a dimension

tag.description: Has comparison expression for a tag

ExportColumnType.description: The type of the column in the export.

ExportComparisonExpression.description: The comparison expression to be used in the export.

name.description: The name of the column to use in comparison.

operator.description: The operator to use for comparison.

values.description: Array of values to use for comparison

ExportExecutionListResult.description: Result of listing exports execution history of a export by name

ExportExecutionProperties.description: The properties of the export execution.

executionType.description: The type of the export execution.

status.description: The status of the export execution.

submittedBy.description: The identifier for the entity that executed the export. For OnDemand executions, it is the email id. For Scheduled executions, it is the constant value - System.

submittedTime.description: The time when export was queued to be executed.

processingStartTime.description: The time when export was picked up to be executed.

processingEndTime.description: The time when export execution finished.

fileName.description: The name of the file export got written to.

apiVersionParameter.name: api-version
apiVersionParameter.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-01-01-preview.
